src: Ka la bo 27 Phatwe 2023 Lefapha la Temothuo, Pusetsodinaga le Tlhabololo ya Metsemagae, ka go dirisana mmogo le Banka e e Thusang Balemi ba Mafatshe ka fa Nageng, ba thankgolotse letsholo la matlole a le kanaka R1,21 bilione la Matlole a go Tlamela Temothuo le Tlhagiso ya Motlakase go Ema Nokeng Balemirui le Dikgwebo tsa Temothuo gore ba kgone go itsenyetsa didirisiwa tse dingwe tse di ka ba thusang ka motlakase gore ba se iphitlhelel ba palelwa ke go tlhagisa dijo le dino.
tgt: On the 27th of August 2023, the Department of Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development, collaboratively with the Land Bank, launched a R1,21 billion Agro-Energy Fund to support the agriculture and agribusiness sector to install alternative energy sources and continue with food, fibre and beverages production.

src: Lekala leno ke le lengwe la makala a a dirisang motlakase o montsi e bile le botlhokwa mo go direng gore naga ya Aforika Borwa e se felelwe ke dijo, e kgone go iponela letseno la go rekisetsa dinaga tsa kwa ntle mmogo le go tlhola ditiro, mme seno ke sona se se dirang gore go nne botlhokwa gore puso e thuse gore maemo a ritibale.
tgt: The sector is one of the intensive energy users and critical for the stability of South Africa’s food security, export earnings and employment, thus making this government intervention vital to ensure sustainability.

src: Matlole ano a buletswe go thusa dikgwebo tsotlhe go sa kgathalesege bonnye kgotsa bogolo jwa tsona ka Dithuso tse di Farologaneng tsa Matlole, mme Banka e e Thusang Balemi ba Mafatshe ka fa Nageng ke yona e e tla laolang Matlole ano.
tgt: The Fund is inclusive and will support farming businesses of all scales in a Blended Finance approach, with the Land Bank managing the Fund.

src: Matlole ano a tla tshegetsa gape le ditiro totlhe tsa temothuo le tsa dikgwebo tsa temothuo tse di tsamaisanang le tiriso e ntsi ya motlakase.
tgt: The Fund will also include all agriculture and agribusiness activities that are energy intensive.

src: Mo pakeng eno ya Letlhomeso la Tirisomatlole ya Pakagare (MTEF) Setheo sa Bosekisi jwa Naga se kgonne go busetsa madi a le kanaka R.2 bilione mme mo go ona matlole ano R.55 bilione ke e e neng e ile ka ntlha ya ditiragalo tsa Go Goga Puso ka Nko.
tgt: Implementation of State Capture Commission recommendations The National Prosecuting Authority assets recovery is R.2 billion in the current MTEF period and R.55 billion of it is State Capture related.

src: Kabinete e neseditse pula dikgato tsa go isa kwa Palamenteng dikarolo tse dintšhwa di le robedi mo go di le 14 tsa melao e e kwalolotsweng sešwa tse di nopotsweng gore di tsenngwe mo Leanong la rona la Dikgato tse di tla Diragadiwang.
tgt: Cabinet has approved and tabled in Parliament eight of the fourteen new legislative amendments identified in our implementation plan.

src: Ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe tiro e tsweletse go dira bonnete jwa gore botlhe ba ba nnileng le seabe mo ditiragalong tsa go go goga puso ka nko ba rweswa maikarabelo.
tgt: Work also continues to ensure that those responsible for state capture are held to account.

src: Go Lwantshana le Bogodu, Bonweenwee le go Kgabaganya Melelwano go se mo Molaong.
tgt: Fight against crime, corruption and illegal immigration The latest Quarterly Crime Statistics show that we must do more as a society to tackle the scourge of crime.

src: Pegelo ya mo malobeng e e ka ga Dipalopalo tsa Dikgetse tsa Bosenyi tsa Kotara e Nngwe le e Nngwe di a bontsha gore re le setšhaba re tshwanetse go tiisa letsogo fa re lwantshana le bosenyi.
tgt: Cabinet calls on everyone to join the fight and to work collectively to make our homes, places of work and public spaces safer for all.

src: Kabinete e ipiletsa mo go motho mongwe le mongwe gore re ipope ngatananngwe mo go lwantshaneng le bosenyi le go nna seoposengwe mo go direng gore malapa a rona, mafelo a re dirang kwa go ona mmogo le mafelo a boitapoloso jwa baagi gore e nne mafelo a a babalesegileng mo bathong botlhe.
tgt: Cabinet further welcomed the extension of the integrated crime-fighting “Operation Shanela” to other provinces, including the Northern Cape, Eastern Cape and KwaZulu-Natal.

src: Kabinete e itumedisitswe gape le ke dikgato tsa go godisa letsholo la go lwantshana le bosenyi la “Operation Shanela” kwa diporofenseng tse dingwe, g akaretsa ya Kapa Bokone, Kapa Botlhaba mmogo le ya KwaZulu-Natal.
tgt: Cabinet noted the recent guilty plea and sentencing of six men accused of killing anti-corruption whistleblower, Ms Babita Deokaran, in August 2021.

src: Kabinete e sekegetse tsebe go ikatlhola ga banna ba le barataro ba ba latofadiwang ka go bolaya yo mongwe wa ba ba neng ba buletsa ditiragalo tsa bonweenwee, e bong Mme Babita Deokaran, ka Phatwe 2021.
tgt: It called on law-enforcement agencies to further investigate and ensure that masterminds behind the murder are brought to book.

src: Kabinete e ikuetse gore ditheo tsa molao di tswelele go dira dipatlisiso go dira bonnete jwa gore bao ba logileng maano a polao eno ba di gama ba sa di tlhapela.
tgt: Cabinet applauded the integrated approach in combating crime that recently led to the Department of Home Affairs intercepting 67 Pakistani nationals who tried to enter the country illegally at the OR Tambo International Airport on Sunday, 13 August 2023.

src: Samiti ya Ngwaga wa 2023 e e ka ga go Fetola Megopolo ya Batho ba Bong jo Botona e e sa tswang go konosediwa e nnile le seabe se se tseneletseng mo bathong ba le 1 500 ba ba neng ba e tsenetse, mme dipuisano tse di tshwerweng di ne di rora jaaka ditau e bile le tshedimosetso e e tlhagileng mo go tsona e ne e le e e bulang matlho mme tseno maitlhomo e ne e le go fetola maitsholo le megopolo ya banna le basimanyana.
tgt: The recently concluded Transforming MENtalities Summit has left an indelible mark on 1500 attendees, with its powerful engagement and insightful discussions poised to pave the way for transformation needs for men and boy behavior.

src: Jaaka e ne e tshwaretswe kwa Birchwood Hotel kwa tikwatikweng ya OR Tambo Conference Centre, samiti eno e ne e tsenetswe ke Ditlhogo, Batlatsatlhogo, Bagokgo le Baeteledipele ba Makgotlha a Dikhole tsa Katiso le Thuto ya Diatla le ya Setegeniki (di-TVET), Mekgatlho e e Emang Nokeng Baithuti mmogo le e e Eteletseng Baithuti Pele, Batlhankedikhuduthamagabagolo (di-CEO)ba Bothati jwa Lekala la Thuto le Katiso (di-SETA), ba ditheo tse di leng ka fa tlase ga Lefapha la Thuto e Kgolwane, Saense le Boitshimololedi, batlhankedi ba ba kwalang dipholisi, batswasetlhabelo ba ditiragalo tsa go bogisa basadi, bankane ba fatlhosanang, mmogo le batho bao ba dirang diphetogo, mme bano botlhe ba ipopile ngatana nngwe ka mosito o le esi e leng go samagana leditiragalo tsa go bogisa basadi mo Ditheo tsa Thuto tse di Latelang Konosetso ya Dithuto tsa Sekolo le kwa Ditheong tsa Katiso (PSET).
tgt: Held at the Birchwood Hotel and OR Tambo Conference Centre, the summit brought together University Vice-Chancellors, Deans, Principals and Council Chairpersons of TVET Colleges, Student Support Structures and Leadership, CEOs of SETAs, entities of the Departments of Higher Education and Science and Innovation, policymakers, survivors, peer educators, and change-makers, all unified by a shared commitment to addressing Gender-Based Violence (GBV) within the Post-School Education and Training (PSET) sector.

src: Samiti eno e ne e tshwerwe ke setheo sa HIGHER HEALTH mmogo le Lekgotla la Dipatlisiso tsa Saense le Batho (HSRC) mo legatong la Lefapha la Ditheo tse Dikgolwane tsa Thuto le Katiso mmogo le Lefapha la Saense le Boitshimololedi.
tgt: The Summit was hosted by HIGHER HEALTH and the Human Science Research Council (HSRC) on behalf of the Department of Higher Education and Training and the Department of Science and Innovation.

src: Maitlhomo e ne e le go buisana le baeteledipele ba lephata leno, go buisana ka ga gore go ka fetolwa jang megopolo e e dirang gore re nne le ditiragalo tsa GBBopaki mmogo le tshedimosetso e e leng teng bobedi bo supa gore banna ke bona ba ba tlhotlhang GBV mme mo Samiting eno go ikuetswe gore go tsewe dikgato gore banna le basimanyana e nne karolo ya ditharabololo.
tgt: The aim was to engage the sector leadership, on transforming mentalities and address the root causes of GBEvidence and data suggest that men behavior has been one of the root causes of GBV and the Summit called for action for men and boys towards being part of the solution.

src: Kwa samiting go ikuetswe gore palo ya bankane ba ba fatlhosanang mmogo le bao ba nang le seabe mo mererong eno e okediwe mo dikhamphaseng tsotlhe, go nna batlisaphetogo mo go fetoleng Megopolo ya Batho ba Bong jo Botona, go oketsa palo ya dipuisano tse di nnang gone mo ditheong tsotlhe tsa thuto, go dira gore mo ditheong tsa thuto tsa PSET go nne le dirutwa tsa segapeletsa tsa go ithuta ka go tsholana ga batho ba bong jo bo farologaneng mmogo le ka GBV, dithuto tsa go lekalekana ga batho ba bong jo bo farologaneng, tsa pharologano ya batho ba bong jo bo farologaneng mmogo le go fetoleng Megopolo ya Batho ba Bong jo Botona.
tgt: The summit asked for the development of more peer educators and champions across all our campuses, to work as change agents towards transforming MENtalities, more men dialogues across all institutions, incorporating gender studies including GBV, gender equality, gender diversity and transforming MENtalities as co-curriculum alongside the main curriculum in the Post-School Education and Training (PSET) sector.

src: Kabinete e amogetse tshedimosetso go e baya mo dinakong ka ga seemo sa motlakase ka fa nageng mmogo le go nopola dipegelo tse di ka ga maemo a a tsweletseng go tokafala mo go direng gore naga e nne le motlakase.
tgt: Electricity Cabinet received an update on electricity situation in the country and noted reports of the continued improvement in electricity availability Although the last few days had recorded an increase in the load shedding stages to stage 4, the situation has since improved with the return of units to generation, and Eskom continues to taper down the load shedding stages.

src: Le fa tota matsatsi a le mmalwa a a fetileng re itemogetse maemo a a kwa godimo a bo 4 a motlakase o o tshabetseng ruri, fa e le ga jaanong maemo a tokafetse mo dikarolo tse dingwe tsa phetlho ya motlakase di buseditsweng tirong ya tsona, mme Eskom e tswelela go fokotsa ditiragalo tsa motlakase o tshabetseng ruri.
tgt: Cabinet was briefed that there are communities that have no electricity due to power outages and not load shedding.

src: Kabinete e tsopoletswe gore go na le metse e e senang motlakase ka ntlha ya motlakase o o tshabetseng ruri le go timelwa motlakase.
tgt: These power outages are caused by system overload due to illegal connections, theft or vandalism of sub-stations and transformers, and vandalism of distribution lines.

src: Go timelwa motlakase gone go tlhodiwa ke go imelwa ga didirisiwa tsa tlamelo ya motlakase ka ntlha ya batho ba ba ikgogetseng motlakase go se mo molaong, go senyediwa le go utswediwa megala ya motlakase mo diteišeneng tse di potlana tsa motlakase le mabokoso a motlakase a a leng mo metseng, mmogo le go kgaolwa ga megala ya motlakase.
tgt: The affected communities include those in parts of Soweto, parts of Thembisa, Kwa-Thema, Komane, Taung md Ditsobotla.

src: Baagi ba ba amegileng ke ba kwa Soweto, Thembisa, Kwa-Thema, Komane, Taung le kwa Ditsobotla.
tgt: The Minister of Electricity and the Department of COGTA have commenced with a programme to engage with the affected communities to agree on measures that will allow the replacement of damaged infrastructure but linked with the prohibition of illegal connections, community partnerships in the protection if electricity infrastructure, and payment for electricity service.

src: Tumelano ya naga ya Aforika Borwa le ya China, e e saenilweng mo malobanyaneng, e tla nna le seabe se se botlhokwa thata mo go nneng le mafaratlhatlha a motlakase a a kgonang go sonaga motlakase.
tgt: South Africa’s Agreement with the Chinese companies, on recently signed agreements, will play a significant role in introducing electricity infrastructure with self preservation capability.

src: Kabinete e lomilwe tsebe ka ga Molaotlhomo wa Maatla a Dipuso tsa Diporofense wa Porofense ya Kapa Bophirima o o kwadilweng o o sa tsamaisaneng le Moaotheo wa naga.
tgt: Western Cape Provincial Powers Bill.1 Cabinet was briefed about the unconstitutional draft Western Cape Provincial Powers Bill.2 The Draft Bill violates the provisions of Schedules 4 and 5 of the Constitution that set out powers and functions including concurrent powers of both the provincial and National executives.

src: Molaotlhomo yono ga o sekegele tsebe Sekejule sa bo 4 le sa bo 5 sa Molaotheo e leng tsona dikarolo tse di tlhalosang gore ditheo dife di na le matla afe go fitlha kae mmogo le maatla a baeteledipele ba dipuso tsa diporofense le ba naga.. Kabinete e nopotse gore Molaotlhomo yono ke maiteko a go busetsa naga mo diatleng tsa mokgatlho wa dipolotiki wa bogologolo wa Democratic Party (e leng mokgatlho o mokgatlho wa dipolotiki wa Democratic Alliance o tsereng lefa leno mo go ona) mme teng go ne go busiwa naga eno ka mokgwa wa sefederale mme seno ke go nyatsa puso e e golaganeng e e tsenyeletsang botlhe ya Aforika Borwa.
tgt: Cabinet has noted that this draft Bill is an attempt to revert back to the Democratic Party’s (forerunner to the Democratic Alliance) preferred federal approach that seeks to undermine a United and inclusive South Africa.4 It is noteworthy that WC draft Bill ignores the exclusion from access to services of the large black communities of Khayelitsha, Gugulethu, Nyanga, Langa, the Cape Flats, Delft, Central Line, amongst others Cabinet has mandated the Ministers of Justice and COGTA to enter into discussions with the Western Cape provincial government in line with the relevant dispute resolution mechanisms as provided for in section 146 of the Constitution and the applicable intergovernmental framework.

src: Go botlhokwa go ela tlhoko gore Molaotlhomo ono wa puso ya porofense ya Kapa Bophirima o itlhokomolosa ka bomo maikarabelo a go akaretsa mo ditirelong tsa yona metse e megolo e go nnang bana ba mmala wa sebilo ya kwa Khayelitsha, Gugulethu, Nyanga, Langa, the Cape Flats, Delft, Central Line, gareng ga e mengwe e mentsi.5 Kabinete e romile Tona ya Bosiamisi le ya COGTA go atlhaatlha kgang eno le puso ya porofense ya Kapa Bophirima go rarabolola kgang eno go ya ka dikgato tse di matshwanedi tsa tharabololo ya dikgogakgogano jaaka di tlhagisiwa go ya ka karolo ya bo 146 ya Molaotheo mmogo le leano le le leng gone la go tsamaisa tiro magareng ga ditheo tsa puso.
tgt: Cabinet decisions Extension of the Taxi Relief Fund disbursement Cabinet approved the extension period for the disbursement of the Taxi Relief Fund for another 12 months.

src: Kabinete e neseditse pula dikgato tsa go atolosiwa ga paka ya go thusa ka matlole beng ba dithekesi ka paka e nngwe ya dingwa di le Go atolosiwa ga paka eno go tla kgontsha Lefapha la Dipalangwa gore le neelwe nako e e tlhokagalang gore le kgone go thusana le matšhwititšhwiti a beng ba dithekisi ba ba iseng ba neelwe thuso ba ba tla tlamelwang ka matlole a go ba thusa.
tgt: The extension will provide the Department of Transport sufficient time to assist the many taxi operators who are yet to receive the relief funds.

src: Go fitlha mo pakeng e re leng mo go yona eno ke beng ba dithekesi ba le 88 580 ba ba setseng ba kgonne go bona thuso eno.
tgt: To date, 88 580 taxi operators have been assisted.

src: Thuso eno e simolotse mo nakong ya fa re ne re le mo pakeng ya dikgatong tsa go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa ka fa nageng ka ntlha ya Bolwetse jwa Mogare wa Corona mme yona e ne e lebeletse go tswa thuso beng ba dithekesi tse dikgolo, tsa dijanaga le tsa e-hailing, mme madi ano a tswa go ya ka lenaneo la bopaki jo bo tshwanetseng go tlhagisiwa ke badiradikopo.
tgt: The fund was established to assist minibus taxis, cabs and e-hailing drivers who were financially disadvantaged during the Coronavirus Disease hard lockdowns, in line with stipulated criteria.

src: Sekwalwa sa Bofelo sa Tetlelelo ya Tiragatso ya go Ntshetsapele Bojanala ka fa Nageng ya Aforika Borwa Kabinete e neseditse pula dikgato tsa go phasalatsa Sekwalwa sa Bofelo sa Tetlelelo ya Tiragatso ya go Ntshetsapele Bojanala ka fa Nageng ya Aforika Borwa gore baagi ba ntshe se se mo mafatlheng a bona ka ga sona.
tgt: Green Paper on the Development of Tourism in South Africa Cabinet approved the publication of the Green Paper on the Development of Tourism in South Africa for public comments.

src: Maitlhomo a sekwalwa seno ke go tlhabolola le go ntshetsa pele lephata la bojanala ka fa nageng ya Aforika Borwa, mmogo le go samagana le dikgwetlho tse di dirang gore lephata la bojanala le retelelwe ke go gola.
tgt: The policy seeks to develop and promote tourism in South Africa, and address barriers to tourism growth.

src: Sekwalwa seno se tla ntshetsa pele gape le bojanala mo mafelong a metseselegae le a metsesekateropo ka go rotloetsa gore ditlhagisiwa tse di tswang kwa mafelong ano di babadiwe le go bewa mo pepeneneng.
tgt: The policy will promote rural and peri-urban tourism by encouraging the profiling and visibility of rural products.

src: Ditshitshinyo tsa pholisi eno le tsona, gare ga dilo tse dingwe tse dintsi, di samagana le merero ya go laola le go dirisana mmogo mo bojanaleng mo taolong ya pabalesego le phemelo mo phetolong ya botshwarateu mmogo le mo go rotloetseng tiriso ya didirisiwa tsa thekenoloji.
tgt: Policy proposals also focus on tourism governance and cooperation safety and security management transformation and embracing technology, amongst others.

src: Baagi ba neilwe sebaka sa matsatsi a le 90 go ntsha se se mo mafatlheng a bona ka ga sekwalwa seno.
tgt: Members of the public have 60 days to make comments on the policy.

src: Sekwalwa seno se ka fitlhelwa mo go: WEBTOKEPholisi ya Naga e e ka ga Metshameko ya mo Seraleng mmogo le Go Ja Leoto.1 Kabinete e neseditse pula Pholisi ya Naga e e ka ga Metshameko ya mo Seraleng mmogo le Go Ja Leoto.
tgt: The Green Paper is available on WEBTOKENational Policy on Theatre and Dance.1 Cabinet approved the National Policy on Theatre and Dance.

src: Maitlhomo a pholisi eno ke go tumola ka moodi tlhokotekatekano le go se tshwarwe ka go tshwana ga baagi e leng selo se se sa bolong go agelelwa mo ditheong tsa rona se se gatang ka mosito o le mongwe le wa tlhaolele le go tswalela mejako ya go iphedisa mo ditheong tsa metshameko ya mo seraleng mmogo le ya ditheo tsa go ja leoto.2 Maitlhomo a pholisi ke go tlhoma ponelopele le dipholisi tse di ka diragadiwang, go loga maano, go tla ka dikgato tse di tla latelwang go tsenya tirisong maano ano mmogo le go tlhagisa dinako tse ka tsona go tshwanetsweng go bo go garetswe go dira gore lephata la metshameko ya mo seraleng mmogo le go ja leoto le tswelele go nna teng le go nna le matlhagatlhaga mo diporofenseng tsotlhe di le robongwe tsa naga, mo badiragatsi ba metshameko ya mo seraleng mmogo le ba go ja leoto ba kgone go ipela mo go emeleng naga ya rona mo kontinenteng le mo lefatsheng ka bophara.
tgt: The policy seeks to address the historically institutionalised inequalities and disparities, which follow racial and economic access lines in theatre and dance.2 The policy aims to set a vision and practical policies, strategies, implementation mechanisms and time frames that will result in a sustainable and vibrant theatre and dance sector in all nine provinces, with South African dance and theatre makers representing the country with pride continentally and globally.

src: Dipegelo tsa go Ela Tlhoko Maemo a Ditlhwatlhwa tsa Dijo tse di Botlhokwa.1 Khomišene e e Okameng Merero ya Dikgaisano tsa Dikgwebo e ntse e etse tlhoko maemo a ditlhwatlhwa tsa dijo tse di botlhokwa go latela gore go nne le ditiragalo tsa go tlhatlosa ditlhwatlhwa ka ditlhwatlhwa tse di kwa godimo e leng ditiragalo tse di simolotseng go iponagatsa fa go ne go nna le Ditiragalo tsa go Emisa Ditiro tsa ka ga Nageng ka Ntlha ya Masetlapelo ka Mopitlwe 20.2 Maitlhomo a go ela tlhoko ditlhwatlhwa tsa dijo ke ka ntlha ya gore ka fa nageng bareki ba dijo ba tshwanetse go kgona go reka dijo tse di botlhokwa tse di rekegang e bile ga di a tshwanela go tlhaela.3 Khomišene e etse tlhoko maemo a a tlhatlogang ka lebelo le le bofefo mo ditlhwatlhwa di tlhatlogetseng ruri ka bonako mme gantsi tlhwatlhwa e di tlhatlogang ka yona e feta eo ba e dirisang fa ba reka dilo tseo ba di rekisang e bile ditlhwatlhwa tse ba rekileng ka tsona fa di fokotsega tseo ba rekisang ka tsona di fokotsega ka bonya.
tgt: Essential Food Price Monitoring Reports.1 The Competition Commission has been monitoring essential food prices pursuant to price gouging concerns raised since the declaration of the State of Disaster in March 2020.

src: E nopotse gape le go tlalatlala ga dijo mo mebarakeng e e rekisang gore le seno ke se sengwe sa dilo tse di nang le seabe mo go seo se diragalang.4 Kabinete e nopotse dikgato tse di tshitshintsweng ke Khomišene mme di tsenyeletsa le dipatlisiso tse di dirilweng mo dimarakeng tseno go samagana le mamo a dimaraka tseno a e leng ona a a dirang gore ditlhwatlhwa di ye kwa godimo mme go se nne le batho ba le bantsi ba ba gaisanang le mabentlele ano a a tlhatlosang ditlhwatlhwa ka ditlhwatlhwa tse di kwa godimo.5 Kabinete e dumetse gore Setlhopha sa Merero ya Ikonomi se tshwanetse go tsenya tirisong leano la go tseela ditlhwatlhwa tsa dijo dikgato, tsa go dira gore dijo di se tlhaele le gore go se nne le ope yo a palelwang ke go iponela dijo.
tgt: The continuation of essential food price monitoring is motivated by the need to ensure affordable and accessible essential food products for consumers.

src: Go thapiwa ga Bakaedi bao e Seng ba Khuduthamaga ba Boto ya Setheo sa Aforika Borwa sa Pabalesego ya kwa Mawatleng (SAMSA) sebaka sa dingwaga di le tharo.1 Rre Mahesh Fakir – Monnasetulo.2 Rre Tau Morwe – Motlatsamonnasetulo.3 Moatefokate Aurelia Nosipho Sobekwa.4 Ngaka Natalie Skeepers.5 Mme Nogolide Feziwe Nojozi.6 Rre Sihle NguseDitiragalo tse di Tlang.
tgt: Ms Nosiphiwo Mzamo as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the State Diamond Trader.

src: Mokete wa monongwaga wa Beke ya Thusong Service Centre o tla tshwarwa go tloga ka la bo 18 go fitlha ka la bo 22 Lwetse 2023.
tgt: The Public Service will celebrate PSM between 1 and 30 September 2023.

src: MaAforika Borwa a lalediwa go tla go ipatlela metseletsele ya ditirelo tse di farologaneng kwa mafelong a Thusong Service Centre a a leng gaufi nabo, jaaka mafelo ano e le mafelo a a tlisang gaufi le bona metseletsele ya ditirelo le tshedimosetso ya puso.
tgt: The month serves as a reminder of what it is to serve, and offers us an opportunity to reflect on how public servants can impact and change the lives of communities.

src: Go bontsha tlotlo mo basading le banneng ba e leng bagale ba rona ba ba thutseng botala ka tlhogo ka ntlha ya ditiro tse ba neng ba di direla setšhaba, Mokete wa Letsatsi la Naga la go Keteka Mosola wa Tirelo ya Sepodisi sa Aforika Borwa (SAPS) o tla tshwarelwa kwa Union Buildings ka Latshipi wa la bo 3 Lwetse 2020.
tgt: National Police Commemoration Day In honour of our heroes and heroines who passed away in the line of duty, the South African Police Service’s National Commemoration Day will be held at the Union Buildings on Sunday, 3 September 2023.

src: Folaga ya naga e tla fokesediwa kwa tlase gona le ka gale go bontsha tlotlo ka letsatsi leno.
tgt: The National Flag will be flown at half-mast on the day of the event.

src: Melaetsa.
tgt: Messages.

src: Melaetsa ya go AkgolaKabinete e romela melaetsa ya yona ya go akgola le go eletsa masego:Mme Natasha Joubert, mmabontle yo a sa tswang go rweswa korone ya go nna Mmabontle wa Naga ya Aforika Borwa mo Ngwageng wa 2023, jaaka a simolola tiro ya gagwe ya go nna Mmabontle wa Naga ya Aforika Borwa.
tgt: CongratulationsCabinet extends its congratulations and well-wishes to: Ms Natasha Joubert, the newly crowned Miss South Africa 2023, as she embarks on her reign as Miss South Africa.

src: Rre Brad Binder, yo a tswileng mo maemong a bobedi mo metshamekong ya mabelo a dijanaga a Austrian MotoGP.
tgt: Mr Brad Binder, who finished second at the Austrian MotoGThe Springboks for beating the All Blacks and wished them well in the forthcoming Rugby World CupIndia, for becoming the first country to successfully land a spacecraft near the south pole of the moon.
